title: The M3 JSON Schema
comment: profile, classes and properties are required; contexts and mappings are not

m3_version.title: Schema Version
m3_version.description: Version number for the M3 specification. Change this to make a new release. Instances will be validated to check they have this version in place.

profile.title: Profile Information
profile.description: Administrative information about the profile or model defined in the file.

date_modified.title: Date Modified
date_modified.description: the date the profile was last altered
date_modified.comment: In YAML, dates must be wrapped in quotes to be validated by json schema

responsibility.title: Responsiblity
responsibility.description: uri for the organization or individual responsible for maintaining the profile

responsibility_statement.title: Reponsibility Statement
responsibility_statement.description: statement of the organization or individual responsible for maintaining the profile

type.title: Type
type.description: type of thing does the profile describe

classes.title: Class Definitions
classes.description: Definition of the classes used in the profile. Classes should be provided with a generic local name for the class, in CamelCase.

display_label.comment: For classes, display label is a string.

schema_url.description: URI for the class, from a local or shared ontology.

contexts.description: A list of contexts in which this class may be used. Empty is taken to indicate all contexts.
contexts.comment: Contexts must match a context defined in the contexts block.

contexts.title: Context Definitions
contexts.description: Definition of the contexts used in the profile. Contexts should be provided with a stable generic local name for the context. Names must be lower case alpha characters separated with underscores.

display_label.comment: For contexts, display label is a string.

properties.title: Property Definitions
properties.description: Definition of the properties used in the model. Properties should be provided with a stable generic local name for the property. Names must be lower case alpha characters separated with underscores.

display_label.description: Human-readable label for the property.  Class or context specific display_labels provided as a list using the class and value.

available_on.description: The classes (objects and/or work types) or contexts this property is available on (defined in 'classes' or 'contexts' section.)

class.comment: Listed values must match a class defined in the classes block.

context.comment: Listed values must match a context defined in the contexts block.

minimum.description: Minimum number of values the property must have.  If there is no value provided, the assumed default minimum is 0. A minimum of 1 means the property is required.

maximum.description: Maximum number of values the property may have.  If there is no value provided, the assumed default maximum is unlimited.

indexing.description: Solr index key to map to, or behavioral flag (facetable, admin_only).

definition.description: The definition for the metadata property being described.

usage_guidelines.description: Description of how the defined property should be used (helper text, hints, deposit text, etc.)

requirement.description: Whether the property is required, optional, recommended, etc. from a best practices standpoint. Please use cardinality - minimum to programmatically set a property to be required.

format.description: Controlled vocabulary constraint on the property's value.

sources.description: Link to a controlled vocabulary source list or file path to a config file listing accepted values.

property_uri.description: URI for the property, from a local or shared ontology.

range.description: Class constraint on the property's value.  If there is no value provided, the assumed default range is http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#Literal

data_type.description: Indicates whether the property can accept multiple values ("array") or a single value ("string").

syntax.description: Type constraint on the property's value. If there is no value provided, the assumed default data_type is http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string. If multiple data types are possible, general best practice is to use the most specific type that applies to all values.  If multiple types are listed, the lowest common denominator will be used for validation.

index_documentation.description: Free text documentation field about whether a property should be faceted, searchable, displayable, treated as text, etc.

validations.description: Regular Expression pattern each value must match to be valid.

match_regex.description: Regular Expression pattern each value must match to be valid.

mapping.description: A pair value defining the target property for a mapping (defined in 'mapping definitions' section.)

mappings.title: Mapping Definitions
mappings.description: Definition of the mappings to different services or target schemas referenced in the profile.
